value.title: Google Tensor gets crushed by Apple A15 in machine learning despite being a ML-centric chip
value.excerpt: The Google Tensor processor is supposed be all about machine learning but it got crushed by the Apple A15 Bionic in the Geekbench ML app.

value.title: Nvidia GeForce RTX 3070 vs. AMD Radeon RX 6800: Which GPU should you buy?
value.excerpt: We compare Nvidia's GeForce RTX 3070 and AMD's Radeon RX 6800 across a wide range of metrics. Performance matters—but the price may matter even more.

value.title: Kontron Launches A New 3.5" Single Board Computer To Help Developers Build An AI-enabled System
value.excerpt: Kontron, a leading global provider of IoT / Embedded Computing Technology, launches a new 3.5" single board computer, named 3.5"-SBC-TGL, powered by 11th Generation Intel® Core™ U-Series processors (Tiger Lake UP3),

value.title: Microsoft powers transformation at NVIDIA GTC Fall—GPU technology conference
value.excerpt: This year during NVIDIA GTC 21, we’re spotlighting some of the most transformational applications powered by NVIDIA accelerated computing that highlights our commitment to edge, on-premises, and cloud computing. Registration is free, so sign up to learn how Microsoft is powering transformation.

value.title: Qualcomm Unveils New Snapdragon 700, 600, and 400-Series Chips for Affordable 5G Phones
value.excerpt: Global chipmaker Qualcomm has introduced four new Snapdragon chipsets under its 700, 600, and 400-series SoC. Check them out here.

value.title: GPU Market Size 2021: Industry Analysis, Size, Share, Growth by 2024
value.excerpt: The overall GPU Market Size is projected to surpass $80 billion mark by 2024, according to a report by Global Market Insights, Inc. The accelerated adoption of AI & IoT technologies across a plethora of industrial sectors is expected to turn graphic processing unit (GPU) market into an extremely lucrative investment ground over the forthcoming years.

value.title: Amazon launches AWS instances powered by Habana’s AI accelerator chip
value.excerpt: Amazon has launched new AWS instances powered by Habana's Gaudi, a chip that accelerates the training of AI models.

value.title: Qualcomm unveils latest mobile chips for mid-range and budget devices
value.excerpt: Qualcomm has added four new Snapdragon mobile chips to its portfolio for both 4G and 5G-capable handsets at varying budget ranges. The Snapdragon 778G Plus 5G, 695 5G, 480 Plus 5G, and 680 4G chips are now official,

value.title: Photoshop update brings new Sensei AI features to desktop, Raw camera support to iPad

value.title: When A Ghost Seemingly Has Taken Your AI Self-Driving Car
value.excerpt: In the spirit of Halloween, consider whether a ghost can drive off or more rightly spirit away with your AI self-driving car.

value.title: Intel CTO Greg Lavender interview — Why chip maker is spending on both manufacturing and software
value.excerpt: Dean Takahashi talks with Intel CTO Greg Lavender about why the chip maker is investing heavily in both manufacturing and software.

value.title: Mercedes is migrating to more expensive chips to plug shortage
value.excerpt: Mercedes took the biggest hit among major U.S. luxury carmakers in the third quarter, with U.S. sales falling 21% from July through September compared to 2020

value.title: Mercedes-Benz to upgrade to expensive chips to resolve shortage
value.excerpt: Daimler's Mercedes-Benz together with Nvidia Corp will develop semiconductors for sophisticated features..Mercedes-Benz registered sales slump of 21 per cent from July to September in the third quarter.

value.title: Arm Aiming For A Huge AI Performance Boost With Next-Gen GPU Architecture
value.excerpt: As AI and machine learning capabilities play bigger roles in everyday tasks, companies like Arm must push the performance envelope.

value.title: Leopard Imaging Launches Hawk 3D Depth Cameras Leveraging NVIDIA Jetson Edge AI and Isaac Robotics Platforms
value.excerpt: Leopard Imaging Inc. (Leopard Imaging), a global leader in high-definition embedded camera design and manufacturing, today announced its new 3D Depth Hawk camera supporting the NVIDIA Jetson edge AI and Isaac robotics platforms.

value.title: Microsoft and AMD will give away a 'Halo Infinite' Radeon RX 6900 XT GPU
value.excerpt: Not only have Microsoft and AMD teamed up to add ray-tracing to the game sometime after launch, they created a limited-edition Radeon RX 6900 XT Halo Infinite graphics card. The GPU’s design is based on Master Chief's Mjolnir armor,

value.title: Tech Top 5: Brainchip nabs US patent for Akida AI chip, jumps almost 15pc
value.excerpt: Brainchip granted US patent, while Elmo boosts revenue and Ansarada expands into GRC market; also semiconductor and cybersecurity updates.

value.title: Poll: Do you think AI chips on phones have lived up to the hype?
value.excerpt: Dedicated AI chips have been available on smartphones for quite a few years now, but have they lived up to the hype?

value.excerpt: AWS customers are increasingly training and fine-tuning large computer vision (CV) models with hundreds of terabytes of data and millions of parameters. For example, advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS) train perception models to detect pedestrians, road signs, vehicles, traffic lights, and other

value.title: The Google Pixel 6 brings a new chip and lofty, AI-powered promises
value.excerpt: The new Google Pixel 6 and Pixel 6 Pro smartphones rely on a custom-built chip to add clever and useful AI-driven features.

value.title: Tensor Is Google’s Camera Centric Chip With Machine Learning Goodness
value.excerpt: Leaks of the Pixel 6 and a new custom chip have been around since October. Yet, Google was quite excited to unveil the Tensor SoC at the event. To clarify, the Tensor chip is an AI wonderland that brings Google’s machine learning goodness right into users’ pockets.

value.title: With Tensor, Google bets on its own chip design for the Pixel 6
value.excerpt: I’m not sure there’s ever been a phone we knew more about before its official launch than Google’s Pixel 6 and Pixel 6 Pro. But in a world of samey Android phones, Google made some interesting choices,

value.title: Google's Tensor chip aims to make the Pixel 6 smarter and last longer
value.excerpt: In an interview with CNET, Google executives talk about why they went through the trouble of building a chip for the newest Pixel.

value.title: Apple unleashes latest AirPods, custom laptop chips
value.excerpt: Apple announced new custom chips, new AirPods and HomePod minis, and a deeper integration of Apple Music with Siri.

value.title: Alibaba Cloud to build own servers with new in-house chip
value.excerpt: Chinese tech giant says it has built its own server chip, called Yitian 710, which is touted to be compatible with the latest Armv9 architecture and will be used to develop new servers that will be deployed across Alibaba's businesses.

value.title: Quris combines AI with ‘patient on a chip’ to speed drug development and reduce animal testing
value.excerpt: The necessity of animal testing is a sad one for the process of drug discovery, but there’s seemingly no good alternative to mice, even though they’re not particularly accurate human analogues. Quris claims to have the first real option in its combination of AI with data from a

value.title: What's So Great About Google Tensor? The New Pixel 6 Chip, Explained
value.excerpt: Google made its own chip to power Pixel 6, but what does that mean for you and for Google? We're coming up on the launch of the Google Pixel 6 and 6 Pro, and, for once, there's a pretty significant change to Google's newest smartphone that isn't just a bigger screen or better camera.

value.title: Scarce chips may pinch Apple's iPhone holiday sales
value.excerpt: According to Refinitiv IBES, analyst are expecting about 45 million units for the fourth quarter and 79.4 million units in the key holiday quarter.

value.title: Spot AI emerges from stealth with $22M with a platform to draw out more intelligence from organizations’ basic security videos
value.excerpt: Security cameras, for better or for worse, are part and parcel of how many businesses monitor spaces in the workplace for security or operational reasons. Now, a startup is coming out of stealth with funding for tech designed to make the video produced by those cameras more useful.
